Virtual Project Expo

Students of IEEE NITK Student Branch work on projects throughout the year within their respective SIGs, mentored by seniors. Additionally, they also mentor freshman student members in selected projects as part of the Envision program. The Expo is an annual event wherein members get to showcase their completed projects for all to see.
Due to this year's unforeseen circumstances, the Expo could not be held in the physical form as usual and was held in a virtual format instead. Blogs containing detailed descriptions, demo videos and further reading material for interested readers were put up for each and every project on the Expo website.

Envision

Envision is an event conducted by IEEE NITK that allows its branch’s new student members to take initiative and work on projects. First year students often do not have the opportunities and facilities to perform relevant projects that help them in their career. This event allows the first year student members propose new project ideas. These ideas can be pertaining to any fields and is not limited to any particular field like computer science or electronics. A selection process is carried out and for each SIG (Computer Society/ Circuits and Systems/ Signal Processing Society), the best ideas are selected. Theseprojects receive funding from the student branch with all the facilities. They are mentored by the Executive members of the student branch.

Engineering the Future

Dr. SK Ramesh is a Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering at California State University and the IEEE President-Elect Nominee 2021. He spoke extensively on the plethora of technical challenges that the world will face as it aims to emerge from the Covid-19 pandemic, as well as the vital role that engineers will play in solving them. He spoke of the fundamental responsibilities of all engineers irrespective of cultural and social divide and how we must work to uplift society.

Introduction to Embedded Coding

A 3-hour long workshop on getting started with Embedded C on AVR Microcontrollers using the Atmel Studio 7. The workshop was opened to the Mangalore Sub Section as well. The workshop covered introductory topics like digital I/O, timers for waveform generators, and PWM.

Dishaspoorthi

Social Outreach Initiative by IEEE-NITK for students of NITK Kannada Medium School
- Talk about career paths in STEM fields
- Attended by 100+ students of grades 8,9,10
- Gifted pens to all students

Higher Studies in a Post-Covid World

IEEE NITK in collaboration with LeapScholar hosted a talk on the state and possible future of Graduate Studies world-over. Abhinav Mishra from Columbia University and Tejas Desai from SUNY Buffalo graced the audience with their presence. They went over topics of drafting your SOP, making your resume and the importance of projects and GPA in applications.

Knowledge Sharing Session | Trends in Technology

IEEE NITK hosted Ganesh Shankar, the CEO of FluxGen Technologies Bengaluru, where he elucidated his journey from an engineering undergraduate to the head of a flourishing startup. Through his story, he inspired the audience to face different ups and downs of life with confidence. Several aspects of engineering and entrepreneurship were discussed. He also shared his thoughts on preparations that a student needs to do before entering the corporate world.

Silicon Maze

A 24 hour programming contest based on various disciplines of Computer Science like Data Structures and Algorithms, Systems, Machine Learning and Development. All questions in the contest were themed around Harry Potter. The event witnessed huge participation of students all across the country.

Knowledge Sharing Session | How to Ace DSA Interviews

This online KSS aimed to provide the audience with tips on tackling DSA interviews, including an in-depth description and analysis of Google’s selection process for Full Time Employees. The event had live interactions with the speaker Dibyadarshan Hota(NITK CSE Batch of 2020, Google FTE), asking him the ins and outs of the on and off-campus interview procedure. The session was rounded off with QnA from the audience.

Praelium 2020

This event aimed to serve as a mock simulation of the global IEEExtreme contest. It was conducted for 6 hours with 10 questions to solve. It was hosted on HackerRank. It aimed to give participants a feel for the duration, format and difficulty level of IEEExtreme. Problems were curated and tested keeping in mind the level of the original contest.

EUREKA

IEEE-NITK​ conducted a fest for the incoming freshers to tell them more about the latest technologies and latest trends . Several workshops were conducted by the 3 SIGs . Every SIG encorporated elements of their specialisations into games making it interesting for the freshers.

REFLECT

We are proud to present for the first time ever in NITK, a week-long event REFLECT, organized by the WIE Affinity Group from 25th October to 1st November 2019. It was a one-week hustle to improve confidence and skills. Involving super interactive, fun activities paired with peer-learning throughout the program. Open to all girls in NITK.

ENLIGHTEN - IEEE DAY Celebrations

Mr. Gajendra Singh is the director of Storage Technologies Ltd. who talked on "NAND Flash and SSD Memories".
- Aimed at providing an insight into an emerging technology and research field to undergraduate students.

Women in Technology Summit

The Women in Technology (WiT) Summit aims to embolden delegates who are currently in the STEM fields to make a change in the community by lending enthusiasm and inspiration from successful women leaders. WiT Summit aims to be a journey into self-discovery and empowerment. A place for participants to discover their hidden talents and spark their technical innovations. It will be an experience like no other, combining the best of IEEE and the Industry network, with some amazing learning and truly fun events that will make the most memorable events so far.
Aim of the Summit is to make an energetic group of Women and Men, utilizing their assorted gifts to improve for the advantage of humankind.

Student Membership Drive 2019 | 2020 Renewal Cycle

Annual Student Membership Drive was held on 2019 – 22nd October to educate NITK student fraternity about the benefits of taking up IEEE Membership and what NITK IEEE Student Branch has in store for the students. A membership development stall was set up and goodies were distributed. This year saw an increase in number of student members who signed up for IEEE membership from NITK.

Annual Project Expo

NITK IEEE members work on projects throughout the academic year and upon completion, the projects are displayed at the Project Expo and students from across Mangalore subsection were invited. This expo turned out to be a big success with a large number of participants visiting the campus to witness the Expo.

Knowledge Sharing Session | Public Key Cryptography

Knowledge Sharing Session introducing Public Key Cryptography(PKC)
- Discussion on RSA- principal algorithm used in PKC
- Applications of RSA in creating Digital Certificates
- Attended by 20 student members
- Subsequent sessions on Elliptic Curve Cryptography and Diffie Hellman Key Exchange to be taken up

IEEE Praelium

IEEE NITK, in association with the Web Enthusiasts Club conducted Praelium, an online coding contest that would help learn all the tricks and skills necessary to ace interviews and dominate contests on platforms such as CodeChef, Hackerrank and contests such as IEEE Xtreme, ACM ICPC etc.
Praelium was a preliminary contest that would allow participants to grasp all the nuances necessary when participating in a contest as big as IEEE Xtreme or the Engineer Coding contests. The contest was conducted a week before the IEEE Xtreme contest keeping in mind this contest would serve as a mock for the actual Xtreme contest. The contest was open to all IEEE members and Bangalore Section. The contest has 88 teams of 3 members each and first three places were bagged by NITK students.

Path Planning for Robotics

The event was a 2 hour workshop by Vasista Ayyagari, who is currently pursuing his MEng in Robotics at University of Maryland, USA. Vasista introduced the topic by speaking about the importance of path planning in robotics and its wide range of applications. He thoroughly explained and executed the codes of basic motion algorithms namely A*, RRT and RRT*. He further explained the use of potential fields in autonomous navigation and how it can be implemented.

Around Her World in 10 Ways

The event had 10 speakers from distinguished fields delivering talks. The speaker line-up was as follows:
  1. Katya Marc
  2. Arya Murali
  3. Prakruthi Heragu
  4. Aditi Chalisgaonkar
  5. Anandi Giridharan
  6. Devi Parikh
  7. Sulabha Kulkarni
  8. Nischita Kaza
  9. Maitreyee Marathe
  10. Kalika Bali

All the speakers held an interactive session on their fields of interest deriving from their personal experiences. The talks ranged from management, career in electronics, deep learning, nano science and bioimaging. They provided invaluable insight into their respective journeys, motivations, successes and failures. They also gave valuable advice for aspiring members of each specialization looking to enter into and navigate those fields.

Talk by GyanDhan | Industry-Student Branch Collaboration

- Talk by Mr Ankit Mehra, CEO of GyanDhan
- Provided insight into the process of applying for an MS degree
- Provided information about education loans, scholarships, GRE study tips and assistantships
- Attended by 100 students

Prometheus

Prometheus is a talk series with speakers from 3rd and 4th year Executive Members from IEEE NITK. Topics included “Learning to Learn via Meta Learning”, “Introduction to Computational Biology”, “Async task processing in the Cloud”, and “Segment Trees for Competitive Programming”.

INSIGHT

INSIGHT'19, our annual flagship event was held on 1st October by IEEE NITK. Comprising of a list of eminent speakers who have successfully established themselves as the most meritorious students in their field, the event was really a one that gave good insight to the students regarding various research internship/project opportunities, national and international programs, benefits of venturing into management post engineering, the placement trends on and off campus and some tips to survive through competition. Students also got an idea of how to go about boosting their résumé by participating actively in reputedcompetitions and working simultaneously on differing prospects to gain wider experience. To summarize, the event was a grand success with a house full audience returning with a streamlined thought, greater confidence and motivation to make it big.

Embedathon

Embedathon is a 24- hour embedded system hackathon challenge hosted by IEEE NITK student branch in association with CAS Society and IEEE Bangalore Section. It presents you with interesting problem statements to ensure a fun-filled learning experience. This is the second edition of the event promising to be bigger and better. In addition to the hackathon, a workshop will also be conducted prior to the final event to enhance your experience with us! Open to Bangalore and Kerala Section as well!

About IEEE

A not-for-profit organization, IEEE is the world's largest technical professional organization dedicated to advancing technology for the benefit of humanity.
